sen.j: 雲図抄（うんずしょう）は、平安時代後期に描かれた儀式書。
sen.e: Unzusho is a book on rites that was written in the late Heian period.

sen.j: 書名は「雲上（清涼殿）での（儀式の）指図」という意味である。
sen.e: The title of the book literally means 'an instruction for rites of Unjo (in other words, Seiryoden or the imperial court)'.

sen.e: The author was identified as FUJIWARA no Tomotaka in "Honchoshojaku mokuroku"(the oldest list of Japanese books in existence written in the Kamakura period).

sen.j: しかし、近代に和田英松が著者をその兄の藤原重隆として編纂年代を1110年代後半と推定してからは通説であった。
sen.e: However, in mordern times, since Hidematsu WADA presumed that the author had been his elder brother, FUJIWARA no Shigetaka, and that the year of compilation had been the late 1110's, this presumption has been widely accepted.

sen.j: だが、江戸時代に藤原為隆の子孫である坊城俊将が、重隆・朝隆の弟藤原親隆を著者とする説を立てている。
sen.e: Nevertheless, in the Edo period, Toshimasa BOJO, who was a descendant of FUJIWARA no Tametaka, advanced a new theory that FUJIWARA no Chikataka, who was a younger brother of aforementioned Shigetaka and Tomotaka, was the author.

sen.j: 藤原為隆は重隆・朝隆・親隆の実兄であり、坊城家にかつてその由来が伝わっていた可能性もあるが、不詳である。
sen.e: Since FUJIWARA no Tametaka was a real brother of Shigetaka, Tomotaka and Chikataka, there was a possibility that the history of the book had been handed down in the BOJO family, but the truth remains unclear.
